title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
coverImage: books/covers/Sapiens A Brief History of Humankind.jpg
description: From a renowned historian comes a groundbreaking narrative of humanity's creation and evolution—a #1 international bestseller—that explores the ways in which biology and history have defined us and enhanced our understanding of what it means to be "human."

title: 21 Lessons for the 21st Century
coverImage: books/covers/21 Lessons for the 21st Century.jpg
description: In twenty-one bite-sized lessons, Yuval Noah Harari explores what it means to be human in an age of bewilderment. How can we protect ourselves from nuclear war, ecological cataclysms and technological disruptions? What can we do about the epidemic of fake news or the threat of terrorism?

title: পূর্ব-পশ্চিম
coverImage: books/covers/পূর্ব-পশ্চিম.jpg
description: A monumental Bengali novel by Sunil Gangopadhyay that chronicles the partition of Bengal and India in 1947. The novel explores the human cost of political upheaval through the lives of ordinary people caught in extraordinary circumstances, depicting the cultural and social transformation of Bengal during this tumultuous period.

title: The Hobbit
coverImage: books/covers/The Hobbit.jpg
description: A fantasy novel that follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by a dragon named Smaug. Bilbo's journey takes him from light-hearted, rural surroundings into more sinister territory, providing the foundation for Tolkien's later epic, The Lord of the Rings.

title: The Lord of the Rings
coverImage: books/covers/The Lord of the Rings.jpg
description: An epic high fantasy novel that follows the hobbit Frodo Baggins and the Fellowship of the Ring on their quest to destroy the One Ring. Set in Middle-earth, this masterpiece explores themes of good versus evil, the corrupting nature of power, and the importance of friendship and sacrifice.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
coverImage: books/covers/To_Kill_a_Mockingbird_first_edition_cover.jpg
description: A novel set in the American South during the 1930s that deals with serious issues of rape and racial inequality through the eyes of young Scout Finch. The story follows her father, lawyer Atticus Finch, as he defends a black man falsely accused of rape.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
coverImage: books/covers/The Hitchhikers Guide to the Galaxy.jpeg
description: A comedy science fiction series that follows the misadventures of Arthur Dent, an unwitting human who escapes the destruction of Earth and travels through space with an alien friend. Known for its absurd humor and philosophical insights about life, the universe, and everything.

title: Gulliver's Travels
coverImage: books/covers/Gullivers Travels.jpg
description: A satirical novel that recounts the adventures of Lemuel Gulliver, a ship's doctor who finds himself in extraordinary lands populated by tiny people, giants, flying islands, and intelligent horses. Swift uses these fantastical journeys to critique human nature and society.

title: The Alchemist
coverImage: books/covers/The Alchemist by Paulo Coelho.jpg
description: A philosophical novel about Santiago, a young Andalusian shepherd who travels from Spain to Egypt in search of treasure. Along the way, he learns about following his dreams, listening to his heart, and recognizing opportunity and life lessons along the way.

title: Robinson Crusoe
coverImage: books/covers/Robinson Crusoe by Daniel Defoe.jpg
description: The story of Robinson Crusoe, a castaway who spends 28 years on a remote tropical island, encountering cannibals, captives, and mutineers before being rescued. Often considered the first English novel, it explores themes of survival, civilization, and human ingenuity.

title: Eleven Minutes
coverImage: books/covers/Eleven Minutes.jpg
description: A provocative novel about Maria, a young girl from a Brazilian village whose first innocent brushes with love leave her heartbroken. She travels to Geneva seeking adventure, but becomes a prostitute and embarks on a journey of self-discovery that teaches her about the nature of sex and love.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Philosophers Stone.jpg
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, introducing eleven-year-old Harry Potter who discovers he is a wizard and begins his magical education at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry. The story follows his adventures as he uncovers the mystery of the Philosopher's Stone.

title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets.jpeg
description: The second book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry returns to Hogwarts for his second year and faces the mystery of the Chamber of Secrets. Students are being petrified, and Harry must discover the truth behind the attacks while dealing with his ability to speak to snakes.

title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban.webp
description: The third book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry learns about his past and meets his godfather Sirius Black. As Dementors guard Hogwarts and threaten Harry, he discovers the truth about his parents' betrayal and learns the Patronus charm to defend himself.

title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire.jpg
description: The fourth book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry is mysteriously entered into the dangerous Triwizard Tournament. As he faces deadly tasks, the story takes a darker turn when Lord Voldemort returns to power, marking the end of Harry's childhood innocence.

title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix.jpg
description: The fifth book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry faces his most challenging year yet. As the Ministry of Magic denies Voldemort's return, Harry forms 'Dumbledore's Army' to teach his fellow students defense against the dark arts, while struggling with his connection to Voldemort.

title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince.png
description: The sixth book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry learns about Voldemort's past through memories while preparing for the final confrontation. The story reveals the secret of Horcruxes and ends with a tragic loss that changes everything for Harry and his friends.

title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows.webp
description: The seventh and final book in the Harry Potter series, where Harry, Ron, and Hermione leave Hogwarts to hunt for the remaining Horcruxes. The story culminates in the Battle of Hogwarts and Harry's final confrontation with Lord Voldemort.

title: Harry Potter and the Cursed Child
coverImage: books/covers/Harry Potter and the Cursed Child.webp
description: A two-part stage play and screenplay that continues the Harry Potter story nineteen years later. It follows Harry Potter as an adult and his youngest son Albus Severus Potter, exploring themes of legacy, friendship, and the weight of the past.

title: The Da Vinci Code
coverImage: books/covers/The Da Vinci Code.jpg
description: A mystery thriller that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he investigates a murder in the Louvre Museum. The case leads him into a web of ancient mysteries, secret societies, and religious history involving the Holy Grail and Leonardo da Vinci's works.

title: Angels & Demons
coverImage: books/covers/Angels & Demons.jpg
description: The first Robert Langdon novel where the Harvard symbologist races against time to prevent the Vatican from being destroyed by antimatter stolen from CERN. The story explores the conflict between science and religion through ancient symbols and modern technology.

title: An Astronaut's Guide to Life on Earth
coverImage: books/covers/An Astronauts Guide to Life on Earth.jpg
description: Former Commander Chris Hadfield shares the lessons learned from his years of training and space exploration. Through anecdotes from his time as an astronaut, he shows how to make the impossible possible, turn problems into opportunities, and approach life with an astronaut's mindset.
